results.title: Sweet sixteen and pregnant
results.creator_credit: Ann Hassett, Dave Bell Associates and John Cosgrove
results.brief_description: Provides case studies of teeage pregnancies looking at the outcome for each girl when it was discovered that she was pregnant. Considers adoption, abortion, keeping the child, and living with one’s family. Highlights the enormous stress of being a teenage mother and points out that girls should fight peer group pressure to have sexual relationships if they do not wish to do so.

results.title: Sweet sixteen
results.creator_credit: Rebecca O'Brien, Sixteen Films, Road Movies, Tornasol Films, Alta Films and Ken Loach
results.brief_description: From the same talented writer (Paul Laverty) and director (Ken Loach) team of “My name is Joe” fame, comes a well-made but similarly realistic and despairing film about the harsh life of a fifteen year-old Scottish youth. Liam (Martin Compston) wants a new life for his mother when she gets out of prison and foils plans by her boyfriend to smuggle drugs inside during a visit with he and his grandfather. After a severe beating by the boyfriend and being kicked out of home by his grandfather, Liam takes refuge at his sister Chantelle’s house (Annmarie Fulton). Liam and his best mate Pinball (William Ruane) try and raise some cash to buy a caravan for his mother on her release but the boys get involved with drug trafficking and gangsters, resulting in a series of events that are also their undoing. Winner of Best Screenplay Award Cannes Film Festival 2002. A UK/German/Spanish co-production.

results.title: Sweet love, bitter
results.creator_credit: Film Three Productions, Lewis Jacobs, Louis W Kellman and Herbert Danska
results.brief_description: Fictional chronicle depicting the last years of jazz musician’s Charlie ‘Bird’ Parker’s life. Capturing the trials and tribulations of a black musician in white America, this film takes an in-depth look at the multi-faceted world of the jazz life — music, drink, drugs, racism, women, and indifference. Features Dick Gregory in the key role as Richie ‘Eagle’ Stokes, with Don Murray playing a down-and-out professor. Adapted from the John A. Williams’ novel “Night song”.

results.title: Sweet dreams [the story of Patsy Cline]
results.creator_credit: Bernard Schwartz, Silver Screen Partners and Karel Reisz
results.brief_description: Jessica Lange stars as country-western singer Patsy Cline, whose tragic death in 1963 cut short one of the most fabulous success stories in the annals of popular music. In contrast with Cline’s rise to fame in the years between 1956 and 1963, her private life was turbulent and tragic. As the wife of hard-drinking Charlie Dick (Ed Harris), Patsy is subjected to all manner of abuse and humiliation, yet she stays on. A happy second marriage is all too short-lived, as is Patsy herself. Patsy Cline’s fans may notice that Robert Gretchell’s screenplay takes quite a few liberties with details of Patsy’s life.

results.title: Sweet Charity
results.creator_credit: Robert Arthur, Universal Pictures and Bob Fosse
results.brief_description: Charity Hope Valentine (Shirley MacLaine) works as an erotic dancer and sometimes prostitute and is constantly unlucky in love. Whatever the disasters in her lovelife, she compensates with a rich fantasy life in which she dreams of meeting a man who will take her away from the sleazy world of the dancehalls. Based on a stage musical scripted by Neil Simon, which in turn was based on Federico Fellini’s “Nights of Cabiria.” “Sweet Charity” is a highly enjoyable screen musical which points to the new direction the musical film was to take in the ‘70’s. Fosse maintains the Broadway plot but he choreographs a stunning series of dance routines around the songs “Big Spender”, “There’s Got to be Something Better than This”, “If My Friends Could See Me Now” and a wonderfully hippie version of “Rhythm of Life” sung by a New Age minister played by Sammy Davis Jr. In “Sweet Charity” Bob Fosse is beginning the experimentation with dance and music which was to lead to his groundbreaking work in “Cabaret.”

results.title: Sweet and lowdown
results.creator_credit: Jean Doumanian, Sweetland Films BV, Sony Pictures Classics and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Set in the 1930s “Sweet and lowdown” is about a jazz musician who achieves a certain level of fame and respect, with his fingerpicking style. Sean Penn plays Emmet Ray, a talented and vain musician who is socially gauche with a crude personality and amoral ways. When Ray is not playing, he is pimping, thieving or shooting rats at the dump for fun. Ray suffers from an inferiority complex to the famous jazz guitarist Django Reinhardt with whom he constantly compares himself. Despite considering that settling down is detrimental to his artistic drive, Ray forms a deep emotional attachment to a mute girl named Hattie (Samantha Morton) who is enchanted by his music. “Sweet and lowdown” retains a light comical edge throughout and should prove delightful to fans of jazz guitar. As a part of its mockumentary style, several contemporary interviews with jazz experts, including Woody Allen, give insight into Ray’s talent, collectively pondering his mysterious demise. Also stars: Anthony LaPaglia, Uma Thurman and Gretchen Mol.

results.title: Swedish peasant paintings
results.brief_description: A study of the “gourd” paintings done by the itinerant peasant artists who flourished in the Dalecarlia district of Sweden in the eighteenth century. The scenes usually have a religious content, although floral motifs are frequently used. The diea of the gourd as the symbol of life is taken from the Book of Jonah and recurs throughout these domestic paintings.

results.title: Swedish cinema classics
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Swedish Institute and Gardar Sahlberg
results.brief_description: The great period of Swedish silent cinema - the epoch of Victor Sjostrom and Mauritz Stiller - is remembered in a series of commented sequences from their original works.

results.title: Sweden is horrible
results.creator_credit: Wedel Films, Radio Sweden and Karsten Wedel
results.brief_description: Swedish “sin” is better known throughout the world than Swedish steel, to judge by the interest shown by many foreign publications. This film will either help to confirm preconceived notions on this subject or, perhaps, give you ideas about greater sexual equality.
